title: Miley Cyrus Heckled at Something Beautiful Film Premiere: â€œThought This Was a Concert!â€
description: Some misinformed fans were upset at the Tribeca Film Festival event. Miley Cyrus Heckled at Something Beautiful Film Premiere: â€œThought This Was a Concert!â€ Eddie Fu
author: Eddie Fu
excerpt: Miley Cyrus was heckled by fans who purchased tickets to the premiere of her new film, who were apparently expecting a performance instead of a screening.
text: On Friday night, Miley Cyrus premiered the film component of her newly released visual album,Â Something Beautiful, at the Tribeca Film Festival. The event was promoted as a â€œone-of-a-kind pop opera featuring thirteen original new songs,â€ with an exclusive conversation with the singer to follow. However, some fans misread the message that it was a movie premiere and loudly heckled her while she was on stage. â€œWe thought this was a concert! We paid $800!â€ one audience member can be heard saying in a video posted on social media. Despite the host reminding them that the event was part of a film festival, they persisted and asked, â€œAre you actually going to sing?â€After more misinformed fans chimed in, Cyrus pacified them with an a cappella version of her 2009 song â€œThe Climb.â€ A comment on Cyrusâ€™ Instagram could provide insight into why some fans didnâ€™t realize they were attending a movie premiere. â€œI bought my tickets [off StubHub]Â and it said MILEY CYRUS LIVE. It wasnâ€™t clear that it wasnâ€™t a concert so yea, for 1200 bucks for 2 crappy far away seats to see a movie and not hear any live music and not even knowing it until I saw chairs on the stage, yea I was livid and felt dupedâ€¦ Iâ€™ll admit maybe it was my mistake for not doing more research but I will say that afterward there were several other people outside saying the same thing.â€ Fans will be able to watch the Something Beautiful visual album in theaters for one night only on June 12th in the US and Canada, with international screenings following on June 27th. Learn moreÂ here. â€œWe thought this was a concert! We paid $800! html:
On Friday night, Miley Cyrus premiered the film component of her newly released visual album,Â Something Beautiful, at the Tribeca Film Festival. The event was promoted as a â€œone-of-a-kind pop opera featuring thirteen original new songs,â€ with an exclusive conversation with the singer to follow. However, some fans misread the message that it was a movie premiere and loudly heckled her while she was on stage.

â€œWe thought this was a concert! We paid $800!â€ one audience member can be heard saying in a video posted on social media. Despite the host reminding them that the event was part of a film festival, they persisted and asked, â€œAre you actually going to sing?â€After more misinformed fans chimed in, Cyrus pacified them with an a cappella version of her 2009 song â€œThe Climb.â€

A comment on Cyrusâ€™ Instagram could provide insight into why some fans didnâ€™t realize they were attending a movie premiere. â€œI bought my tickets [off StubHub]Â and it said MILEY CYRUS LIVE. It wasnâ€™t clear that it wasnâ€™t a concert so yea, for 1200 bucks for 2 crappy far away seats to see a movie and not hear any live music and not even knowing it until I saw chairs on the stage, yea I was livid and felt dupedâ€¦ Iâ€™ll admit maybe it was my mistake for not doing more research but I will say that afterward there were several other people outside saying the same thing.â€

Fans will be able to watch the Something Beautiful visual album in theaters for one night only on June 12th in the US and Canada, with international screenings following on June 27th. Learn moreÂ here.
